alert.note: Alert for Hill County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:21PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hill County through 800 PM MDT... At 720 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gildford, or 21 miles north of Big Sandy, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Box Elder, Beaver Creek and Laredo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
